text: Does python have an equivalent to Java Class.forName()?
I have the need to take a string argument and create a class in python.
In Java, I would use Class.forName().newInstance().
Is there an equivalent in python?
To answer those who want to know what I'm doing: I want to use a command line argument as the class name, and instantiate it.
I'm actually programming in Jython and instantiating Java classes, hence the Java-ness of the question.
